Project management process This is the most important area and the primary role of the PMO is to ensure development and implementation of consistent as well as standardized business processes. As a part of the project management process, PMO helps in creating a common set of principles, practices, and templates for managing various organizational projects. Standardization refers to ease of movement for manager between different or multiple projects as well as quick learning curve of new project managers. Through creation of project management templates, the use of standard components or principles for multiple projects is ensured and this, in turn, saves both time and money for any organization. Data gathering The PMO is responsible for gathering of relevant project data and has to produce information to be presented for review by the management. Based on updates by project managers related to a single or multiple projects, the PMO will be responsible for tracking the overall status of those projects. They will assist in standardization of the compilation of information and ways of reporting the same to the management. Portfolio management If an organization has already implemented project portfolio management (PPM), it is the responsibility of the PMO to manage and facilitate the entire process. The responsibilities will include: Managing resource forecast or creating a resource capacity plan. This will help in understanding the availability of various resources for organizational projects Enable capture of project requests and ensure each of those requests have enough relevant information that can aid in the assessment of that project Maintaining an updated status of projects that are underway and those that have requests pending review Implement prioritization and scoring models for better assessment of the requests that should be approved

Duties include but are not limited to the following: PRODUCT TRAINING/DELIVERY (PRINTER, SOFTWARE & ACCESSORIES) Train the client on proper installation of printer & software, configuration of printer driver settings & software, discuss printer parts & their functions, proper usage of ID printer, software & accessories, proper maintenance & basic troubleshooting Sometimes collect the payment of the delivered unit. IN-HOUSE/ON-SITE SERVICES Diagnostic (diagnose unit and isolate the problem, & inform/advise client of any necessary parts to be replace or adjust) Preventive Maintenance (clean the printer, sensor adjustment, diagnose parts possible for replacement) Printer / Software assistance (assist client’s in minor software & printers problems, set-up, configuration, & layout or color adjustment) Printer Repair (responsible in dismantling & repairing printer, replacing or mechanical adjustment of parts). PRODUCT DEMONSTRATION Assist Sales person in conducting product demonstration. Answers to any technical queries of clients that cannot be answered by the sales person. Explain to the client how the ID printing system works and how the flow is done, step by step. Discuss the strength of the software/printer & discuss its advantages over other software and printers. PHONE SUPPORT ASSISTANCE Assist clients thru phone on printer and software concerns, as much as possible isolate the problem, & then provide step by step instructions to solve thru phone to minimized the on-site services Also, answer technical queries that salesperson cannot answer PRINTER PREPARATION (DEMO/DELIVERY/RENTAL/SERVICE UNIT/EXHIBIT) Delivery (Calibrate & adjust newly brought printer from stock. Calibrate printer for best output that acceptable to the client. Sometimes calibrate the printer to the layout given by the client) Demo / Rental Service Unit / Exhibit (Prepare the unit based on schedule form given by the sales person. Test the unit & calibrate to make sure that the unit will print smoothly. Check accessories of unit & make sure it is complete according to the schedule form.) Proper labelling of serial number in schedule form is needed and marking in box is required. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Electronics and Communication Engineering At least 1 to 2 years’ experience as Technical Service engineer or equivalent With background in Electrical Equipment, repair of card printers or equivalent Know how to diagnose and troubleshoot basic technical issues Technical trainings in electronics

Solution Delivery Engineer I Location: Taguig City, Philippines The Solution Delivery Engineer, Level 1 role is responsible for the successful deployment, testing, and elevation to the production of the NICE inContact Portfolio of solutions and service offerings. This includes, but is not limited to1, the installation of hardware/software/customizations; to support new versions/features; and/or support system expansion, upgrade, or migration. Solution Delivery Engineer, Level 1 is also responsible for working in partnership with the Architecture, Project Management, and Product Management Organizations to conduct Proof of Concept (PoC) staging of NICE inContact Portfolio solutions. As a Solution Delivery Engineer I, a Typical Day Might Include the Following: · Collaborate with various NICE inContact departments (Support, Product Management, R&D) and Customers from around the globe to deliver and support, highly available, complex, and fully distributed solutions: focusing on quality, stability, and reliability. · Maintain high customer satisfaction throughout the entire delivery life cycle. · Conduct thorough and detailed troubleshooting to provide quality support to the client, and minimize escalations · Design and develop automation of Delivery processes · Strong Task Management skills · Participate in knowledge transfer activities as required . To Land This Gig You'll Need: · Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Software Engineering (or similar) or equivalent work experience required. · 5+ years of experience working within application or software support and/or installation. · 5+ years of experience working within public or private cloud environments. · 5+ years of experience working in a Windows-based environment including both production and personal systems. · 5+ years of experience working with NICE Quality Management, Performance Management, or Workforce Management products. · 5+ years communicating in English in a technical field. · Experience in Web Applications support, especially MS Failover Clusters · Experience in Database Troubleshooting and Tuning (MS SQL) · Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills · Experience working with call centers and call center infrastructure · Experience with one or more of the following: PowerShell, JavaScript, Python. · Experience with Linux, especially CentOS or RHEL · Working knowledge of SIP-based communication Experience Preferred: · Amazon Web Services · F5 Load Balancers · AudioCodes Session Border Controllers · Ribbon Session Border Controller This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive, and employees will also perform other reasonable related business duties as assigned by the immediate supervisor and other management as required. This organization reserves the right to revise or change job duties as the need arises. This job description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment. ABOUT NICE inContact: NICE inContact makes it easy and affordable for organizations around the globe to provide exceptional customer experiences while meeting key business metrics. NICE inContact provides the world’s No. 1 cloud customer experience platform, NICE inContact CXone™, combining best-in-class Omnichannel Routing, Workforce Optimization, Analytics, Automation, and Artificial Intelligence on an Open Cloud Foundation. NICE inContact is a part of NICE (Nasdaq: NICE), the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions.

Perform construction and maintenance of OSP infrastructure according to industry standards. Maintain safety and security of OSP facility. Determine scope, budget and schedules for OSP projects. Perform routine inspection of OSP networks.

JOB DESCRIPTION Technical Inspection Formulate arrival inspection report of equipment. Ensure the completeness of delivered machine, accessories, parts or peripherals and record accurate details of packing list against delivery (with warehouse personnel) Check the physical condition of the machine, crates and boxes. Perform initial functional evaluation together with the application personnel to ensure proper functionality. Delivery Information Formulate delivery inspection report (DIR) for documentation. Set up machine and accessories to verify functional accuracy before the delivery. Documentation of over-all functional evaluation and specific result details. Pre Installation Requirement Verify the room site or location before the machine installation. Assessment of room size, room ventilation and lighting condition. Verify the power line and source, active grounding line, type of pipes and fittings for medical gases. Make an accurate report and recommendation signed by the costumer(s) and Field Engineer. Actual Inspection Site installation of machine. On site sensor calibration, setting adjustments, ensure and provide technical reports signed by the customers(s). Conduct basic troubleshooting to the end-user(s) and hospital engineer. Repair/Maintenance and Support Repair of Machines Formulate Service Protocols which develops individual responsibility for the purpose of proper customer service. Perform technical evaluation before recommendation and prioritize schedule depends on the situation and necessity. Provide RFQ address to the costumer noted and signed by the immediate department head. Maintenance Under Warranty Provide efficient service with complete calibration procedure and perform regular service visit depending on the warranty period agreement between company and customer. Assessment of functional accuracy, provide technical report and honest recommendation to achieve customer satisfaction. Maintenance under contract Offer Preventive Maintenance Service (PMS) agreement while explaining to the customer the value of prevention of machine downtime and ensure patient’s safety. Make additional and profitable income in the company which can help to build effective and reliable service department through wide range of service tools and test equipment. Technical Support If necessary, attend and support sales people in any customer concerns, pre-bid or bidding proper to ensure of have ideas in procurement specifications. Provide technical support for the Application or Product Specialist people during product demo/presentation to attend any technical issues. Reports and Monitoring Job Order Number Create Job Order Number to monitor machine’s status such as: installation, maintenance, evaluation and repair which leads to effective monitoring that can organize concerns of the customer(s). Formulate Service Report Forms, PMS checklist or revised maintenance procedure without compromising manufacture guidelines. Escalation of unsolved service issues to the immediate department head. On time submission of reports to the immediate head. Attend regular meetings, conventions and trainings to enhance technical knowhow which can resolve different service issues. QUALIFICATION Graduate of any 4 year course preferably engineering or any technical course Preferably with experience from the medical industry or medical facilities Good oral and written communication skills Result oriented Willing to travel nationwide

Project management process This is the most important area and the primary role of the PMO is to ensure development and implementation of consistent as well as standardized business processes. As a part of the project management process, PMO helps in creating a common set of principles, practices, and templates for managing various organizational projects. Standardization refers to ease of movement for manager between different or multiple projects as well as quick learning curve of new project managers. Through creation of project management templates, the use of standard components or principles for multiple projects is ensured and this, in turn, saves both time and money for any organization. Data gathering The PMO is responsible for gathering of relevant project data and has to produce information to be presented for review by the management. Based on updates by project managers related to a single or multiple projects, the PMO will be responsible for tracking the overall status of those projects. They will assist in standardization of the compilation of information and ways of reporting the same to the management. Portfolio management If an organization has already implemented project portfolio management (PPM), it is the responsibility of the PMO to manage and facilitate the entire process. The responsibilities will include:Managing resource forecast or creating a resource capacity plan. This will help in understanding the availability of various resources for organizational projectsEnable capture of project requests and ensure each of those requests have enough relevant information that can aid in the assessment of that projectMaintaining an updated status of projects that are underway and those that have requests pending reviewImplement prioritization and scoring models for better assessment of the requests that should be approved

Description To provide systems-related, reports analytics and documentations support to the global FLMC Departments such as Engineering, Marketing, Manufacturing and others, from the executive to the staff level. Responsibilities Duty 1: Technical Writing - Gathers engineering data needed to create technical documents - Edits minor and major documents (e.g. global best practices, I&Ms etc.), writings, and illustrations based on the organization's product information and specification provided by product experts and engineers using the standard document templates. provided by various FLMC organizations using the standard document templates. - Edits and lays out translated documents to align with the English documents. - Researches engineering resources and reviews documentation. - Creates Engineering Change Notice and facilitates approval and upload. - Proofreads documents - Coordinates with internal POC for translations - Performs internal quality check on technical documents requests. (Standard/Checklist) - Ensures availability of current revision to pertinent users Duty 2: Projects and Documentations Management and Control Projects Management - Escalates Business Intelligence Tools (e.g., TimeSheet Central, ECN Central) concerns to proper point person. - Grants access rights to Business Intelligence Tools (e.g., TimeSheet Central, ECN Central) - Reviews project details and decides to escalate for approval or rework. Documentation Control - Gathers, collects, organizes and/or sends electronic copies of documentations to requestor - Updates standard document with required customer information. - Uploads Approved Documents into Business Tools. - Escalates Documentation Issues to appropriate individuals. - Reviews completeness of customer and third-party data and prepares documentation requirements. - Reconciles certification invoices with actual certificates. Duty 3: Metrics, Reporting and Analysis Report Scoping and Planning - Coordinates and validates with stakeholders on reporting requirements (e.g., headcount). - Clarifies, evaluates and recommends scope, timeline and report structure. Data Gathering - Extracts/generates quantitative information from a single or multiple tools Business Intelligence Tools (i.e. CSR, Engineering Project Management, ECN Central database, etc.) - Communicates with resource person to get input/raw data needed for report generation Data Manipulation - Cleans extracted data using pre-defined guidelines or instructions - Formats extracted data based on expected report output. - Calculates data using available fields within the gathered information (basic math) Reporting - Creates reports based on standard templates Duty 4: Operation Support Continuous Improvement and Process Documentation - Support opportunities for continuous improvement to support BU's goals and objectives. - Updates and creates documentation using standard project templates; stores and organizes the documents to the team's repository - Performs research and analysis to validate if the detailed solution is the best fit to meet the requirements. - Initiates actions. Local Objectives Support - Participate in meetings for local initiatives, Team Meetings, Operations Review - Records and submits periodic and/or monthly Monitoring sheets/trackers/reports. Ability to read and interpret blueprints and compliance schematics. Advanced mechanical and diagnostic skills. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work outdoors in extreme weather conditions. Physically fit and able to lift heavy equipment.

Requirements BS or MS in Computer/Electronics/Electrical Engineering with 10+ years of design verification experience10+ years experience in Digital Design and Verification, Verilog, System Verilog, C/C++ is idealKnowledge of the following through education and/or experience:UVM, assertion-based, and constraint-random verificationVerilog, C/C++, PythonExpertise in DDR, PCIe, Ethernet, AMBA, and serial communication protocols is desiredDomain Knowledge in Machine Learning, Embedded System, Video and Audio systems a big plusGood teamwork and able to collaborate with multi-site teamsGood written and verbal communication skillsWilling to work in Alabang Job Summary The position will be responsible for verifying soft IPs for a number of different Lattice FPGA families. The candidate should be able to create test plan, design and architect testbench, do functional simulation, analyze and debug the design, communicate all findings to design team, and extract verification metrics to sign-off the design. The ideal candidate is also expected to work on improving soft IP verification process via automation and scripting. The candidate will develop comprehensive verification plans, clear metrics and continuously measure progress again the plan throughout the project. Testing can be done by writing Verilog or UVM testbench and running simulations or perform hardware validation on an actual FPGA device. He/she is also expected to develop verification components as needed. The ideal candidate may also act as a technical lead and help develop best practices and world class methods for verification.

The candidate is expected to develop and design soft IPs for a number of different FPGA families. The candidate is also expected to act as technical lead in developing the right soft IP in line with the company's Affordable Innovation strategy. Requirements BS/MS EE/ECE/CoE with 10+ years of IC design experienceKnowledge of the following through education and/or experience:IP architecture evaluation and definitionRTL coding design, with tradeoffs based upon different standard cell library attributesSynthesis, P&R, Timing closure with different methods and toolsASIC or FPGA product design through productionC++Scripting for automating repeatable processesExpertise in Python, Tcl/Tk scripting is a big plusMust have hands-on experience as project or technical lead and in people managementExpertise in protocols such as AXI, AHB, APB, SPI, I2C/I3C, MIPI, DDR, PCIe, Ethernet is desiredDomain Knowledge in Video and Audio systems a big plusStrong knowledge of semiconductor principles and integrated circuit design and layout considerationsGood teamwork and able to collaborate with multi-site teamsGood written and verbal communication skillsMust be willing to work in Alabang

In case the link fails to take you to the SITEL page, please copy the URL below and start your application through the SITEL portal using your browser. https://philippines.sitel.com/sitel-barkada-jbs/ To fast track your application please make sure to finish your online assessment. You may contact us at 09778078719 if you need assistance on your application. Who are we looking for? We are looking for passionate individuals who can deliver personalized and memorable experiences for our clients and customers. Customers will rely on you to answer questions, address their concerns, and help them with a particular product or service. You simply need to know your way around a computer and be comfortable supporting customers through phone, chat and email. Join us today in building trust, being bold, working together and wowing our customers! What are we looking for? - Candidates who are at least 18 years old and above - Completed at least two (2) years of college education - Basic computer navigation skills - Good command of the English language - Willingness to work on shifting schedules - With at least 6 months Call Center Experience (Preferred) What should you expect from us?- Paid training from day one- Tons of growth opportunities (93% of our non-agent positions are filled internally)- A leadership team that hears your voice; we know that when we work together we can accomplish so much more- Fun team environment where we work hard to build trust every single day- HMO Benefits for you and your family- Free Shuttle service on selected locations (Pick-up points)

The Field Engineering Manager (FEM) is responsible for the overall functioning of the Field Engineering team across the company. The Field Engineering function is responsible for the implementation, maintenance and fault rectification/restoration of the physical network and physical network assets on behalf of our customers and network operators. They are also responsible for delivering surveys, implementation and other field services to stakeholders. This role will ensure that the field engineering teams and activities are running smoothly, on time and meeting or exceeding quality. The FEM works closely with the technical leads such as Implementation Leads, Project Coordinators, and other engineering members and PMO and Management within the company, with occasional direct contact with customers or stakeholders. FEM is responsible to deliver, improve and enhance the overall process, procedures and know how to operate the team effectively and efficiently while remaining responsive to business objectives.

The Service Fulfillment Manager is primarily responsible in ensuring service fulfillment of Cable and Broadband related issues. He or She shall ensure capability of technical personnel to handle and resolve multi technology requirement or new services and products as well as smooth handover of the issues or fault until completion. He or She is also responsible for the management of work order fulfillment, on time service and first visit resolution in adherence to the standard service level agreement (SLA). Responsibilities: Ensures capability of technical personnel to handle and resolve multi technology requirements or new services/products. Reviews the quality and accuracy of event data in line with compliance checks based on available tools and platforms Manages client cases and escalation from Client Operations teams or any available channels Monitors and escalates temporary corrective remedies to facility breakdown if permanent resolution would exceed standard network fault restoration. Monitors compliance, dispatch work order status and resolution information via dispatch Work Force Management System or any related system needed to fulfill required services. Manages the coordination with other department/divisions/sections concerned to fast track the completion of any technical or network related problems. Manages work order fulfillment for all Cable and Broadband premise service activities. Ensures augmentation of drop service capacity during emergency, sporadic events and contractor deficiency. Conducts time to time field supervision of all drop related special projects and other activities. Reviews on-the-spot team inspection to ensure personnel adherence to company policies including but not limited to safety, technical standards compliance, grooming, efficiency and productivity. Performs ocular inspection as may be required such as survey of cable lines for span sag, vertical clearance, kink or damage and status of other network electronics. Ensures spare material, tools and equipment availability. Submits required reports in compliance with existing company requirements. Provides management plans and directives to field personnel. Minimum Qualifications: Must have a Bachelor’s Degree in Electronics, Engineering or any related discipline; preferably Licensed Engineer with Cisco certification or any equivalent certificate With at least 7 years relevant working experience in Cable, Telco environment and 3 years supervisory experience leading team of technician and engineers Has a strong analytical skill in CATV, IP or LAN/WAN Network Has an experience on IP Network Systems Has capability to do capacity and logistics planning in order to support daily requirements, thus ensuring proper utilization of existing resources Willing to work in varied shifts and remains on-call on emergencies With professional Driver’s License

JOB DESCRIPTION Technical Inspection Formulate arrival inspection report of equipment. Ensure the completeness of delivered machine, accessories, parts or peripherals and record accurate details of packing list against delivery (with warehouse personnel) Check the physical condition of the machine, crates and boxes. Perform initial functional evaluation together with the application personnel to ensure proper functionality. Delivery Information Formulate delivery inspection report (DIR) for documentation. Set up machine and accessories to verify functional accuracy before the delivery. Documentation of over-all functional evaluation and specific result details. Pre Installation Requirement Verify the room site or location before the machine installation. Assessment of room size, room ventilation and lighting condition. Verify the power line and source, active grounding line, type of pipes and fittings for medical gases. Make an accurate report and recommendation signed by the costumer(s) and Field Engineer. Actual Inspection Site installation of machine. On site sensor calibration, setting adjustments, ensure and provide technical reports signed by the customers(s). Conduct basic troubleshooting to the end-user(s) and hospital engineer. Repair/Maintenance and Support Repair of Machines Formulate Service Protocols which develops individual responsibility for the purpose of proper customer service. Perform technical evaluation before recommendation and prioritize schedule depends on the situation and necessity. Provide RFQ address to the costumer noted and signed by the immediate department head. Maintenance Under Warranty Provide efficient service with complete calibration procedure and perform regular service visit depending on the warranty period agreement between company and customer. Assessment of functional accuracy, provide technical report and honest recommendation to achieve customer satisfaction. Maintenance under contract Offer Preventive Maintenance Service (PMS) agreement while explaining to the customer the value of prevention of machine downtime and ensure patient’s safety. Make additional and profitable income in the company which can help to build effective and reliable service department through wide range of service tools and test equipment. Technical Support If necessary, attend and support sales people in any customer concerns, pre-bid or bidding proper to ensure of have ideas in procurement specifications. Provide technical support for the Application or Product Specialist people during product demo/presentation to attend any technical issues. Reports and Monitoring Job Order Number Create Job Order Number to monitor machine’s status such as: installation, maintenance, evaluation and repair which leads to effective monitoring that can organize concerns of the customer(s). Formulate Service Report Forms, PMS checklist or revised maintenance procedure without compromising manufacture guidelines. Escalation of unsolved service issues to the immediate department head. On time submission of reports to the immediate head. Attend regular meetings, conventions and trainings to enhance technical knowhow which can resolve different service issues. QUALIFICATION Graduate of Engineering course Preferably with experience from the medical industry or medical facilities Good oral and written communication skills Result oriented Willing to travel nationwide

Job Responsibilities: The PMO Project Manager oversees the full project management life cycle and delivery development life cycle for the implementation of highly complex, large-scale, strategic and business initiatives. Additional responsibilities include: Implementing established policies, system monitors and controls to ensure the successful management and reporting of all corporate initiatives in the program Supervising and leading the program and project staff to oversee the impacts and interdependencies between programs and working to ensure initiatives meet the goals and objectives of the executive leadership team Providing both verbal and written communications regarding project status, risks and issues Analyze Financial Information - A significant portion of a PMO Manager’s job is the analysis of financial data as it pertains to each project in their control. This includes the proper distribution and allocation of resources, the implementation of budgets and the quantification of monetary risk and impact. In addition to those duties, PMO Managers will frequently need to provide budget outlines and financial reports to executives, such as the Chief Financial Officer. Modify Processes - Once a project is underway, a PMO Manager’s work is not done. It is their responsibility to make sure that all processes related to a project’s completion are carried out in the most efficient and effective manner while simultaneously upholding a given set of standards. To accomplish this, PMO Managers will need to improve new and pre-existing processes, continually reevaluate whether each project is meeting the applicable standards and engage in problem solving with other Managers and personnel.

Position Key Functions: Demonstrate leadership to the Engineering team by providing clear guidance and direction. Chair weekly engineering open issues meetings and hold the team members accountable to completing tasks on time. Lead the development and delivery of cost competitive designs on time, within budget, meeting quality target and customer requirements. Lead the Project Engineering for Awarded Products from development, launch and until production. Engineering customer interface. Project Engineering budget, forecast and expense control (resources, expenses and CAPEX). Organize and lead engineering teams worldwide (HW, SW, Electromechanical, Safety, Cybersecurity ,Testing, etc.) according to development needs, assuring engineering deliverables and execution. Lead and follow-up engineering meetings, internally (Lear) and externally (Customer). Lead creation of BOM and have visibility over component costs, to support achievement of product competitiveness targets / CTO roadmaps / material cost. Lead technical evaluation of product changes (ECR, PCR, DFM, etc.). Manage engineering risk that could affect project milestones. Actively participate in engineering process improvements and continuous improvement initiatives. Development and Implementation of Dashboards including KPIs, control charts per project. Job Requirements Degree in Electronics, Electronics Communication or Industrial Engineering Technical and Management skills/experience Analytical and adept decision maker. Work experience that enables the resolution of difficult to moderately complex issues. Excellent communication skills.

Job Responsibilities: Assess the Client’s Needs - After a project begins but before implementation actually starts, implementation project managers are responsible for assessing the client’s exact needs and creating a plan to meet those needs. This assessment usually comes in the form of many meetings with the client’s department heads and other stakeholders. Manage Team of Implementation Specialists - Implementation project managers are responsible for managing a team of implementation specialists, who develop delivery requirement for the client. They ensure teams are on task and team deadlines are met. Manage Conflict Between Internal Teams and Client - Once in a while during a project, conflict arises between internal teams and the client. Implementation project managers are responsible for managing this conflict and ensuring the problem is solved before the quality of the project is compromised. Report on Project Progress - Implementation project managers communicate frequently with key stakeholders to report on the project’s overall progress. These reports typically include discussing any problems the teams have had with the client and vice versa.

+KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES Monitor status of network and customer circuits through the Network Management System. Update NOC switch log system in a timely and accurate manner. Conduct complex fault isolations, map circuit configuration if fault-related, analyze and implement proper isolation procedures. Prioritize the isolation of complex faults that involve: Core network, complex customer application, routing issues and those that have been escalated to management. Review and analyze complex network/circuits and provide a better isolation procedures. Review fault and recommend test plan to identify root cause of the issue. Coordinate with field groups, third party provider and customer; conduct tests and/or circuit reviews as necessary. Initiate meeting with the fault stakeholders to identify actions taken on the issue and develop a restoration plan. Conduct RFC, layer 2 and layer 3 testing (ex. BER and FE testing of the link segments) and ensure that the circuit is within the telecom standards. Conduct IP connectivity test (Ping, trace routes, bandwidth test, verification commands) and resolve issues and anomalies. Coordinate and assist foreign and local counterpart, customers and field group during restoration. Recommend alternate solutions to streamline procedures and processes for swift delivery of service. Monitor and participate in scheduled preventive maintenance and testing. Handle the customer management of prolonged outages. Updates the NOC Factbook. Gathers information and maintains data on current network loading. Assists Team Leader in: Summarizing and evaluating causes of circuit downtimes. Implementing programs for efficient and effective network management. Lead, teach and train colleagues effective and swift techniques for fault isolation and restoration. Introduce process improvement and procedure by challenging existing processes using outside research and technical training Recommend improvements and adaptation of new technology to current processes. Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as may be assigned or apparent. EDUCATION (Degree, licensure, & certification) Bachelor's degree in Electronics and Communications Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or any related course. Preferrably licensed ECE/EE EXPERIENCE With at least 4 yrs experience in NOC/SOC operations or in any equivalent field Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Possess excellent oral and written communication skills General knowledge of MS Office applications (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Visio) Advanced knowledge and skills in circuit fault isolation and troubleshooting. High proficiency in basic troubleshooting, configuration, testing of different Network devices such as SDH, Routers, Switches, Media Cnnverters and other Networking devices. Strong knowledge in using different test equipment such as Ethernet tester.

The Firmware Development Engineer is responsible for providing high quality embedded code or firmware running on different devices. He/ She will be involved in the design and development of firmware for our next generation of products. He/ She will provide solutions or algorithms in solving some of the challenging requirements in the world of embedded software. Qualifications: · BS or MS in Electronics Engineering or Computer Engineering · At least 2 years of relevant work experience · Proficiency in the whole software development life cycle (SDLC) · Programming experience in C (C++ is a plus) in the field of embedded programming · Knowledge of assembly language programming · Experience working and interfacing with the different communication protocols such as I2C, SPI, UART, CAN, LIN, etc. and other microcontroller peripherals such as ADCs, DACs, timers, PWMs and GPIO · Experience using different electronics laboratory equipment such as scopes, analyzers, signal generator, JTAG/ICE debuggers, etc. · Experience using different IDE and software versioning tools · Hands on experience performing unit testing, firmware verification and system testing · Familiarity with some of the coding standard and guidelines e.g. MISRA C · Experience on using Real Time OS preferred · Test Driven Development experience a plus · Familiarity and experience on the different software development methodologies, e.g. Agile, Waterfall, V-model

Your typical day will include: Building domain expertise in your area of responsibility. This includes creating prototypes, problem solving, and delivering shippable features.Collaborating with stakeholders to solidify requirements and working with various teams to accomplish your tasksAsking relevant questions and participating in brainstorming and code reviewsSifting through data and information quickly to identify what is essentialTracking of and adhering to delivery schedules We invite you to join our team, if: You rock a BS degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, Electronics & Communications Engineering, or Electrical Engineering Programming gets you all excited. You know C/C++ like the back of your hand.Investigating and squashing bugs is a cathartic experience.You have knowledge on embedded firmware & Unix/Linux/Embedded environment (e.g. “sudo make-me-a-sandwich"), that’s a plus.You have background in firmware/software development phases – from product definition through code maintenanceYou are adaptive to change and/or have familiarity of the AGILE/SCRUM processYou are an ambassador of best programming practices (code reviews, unit testing, automation)You are a brainstormer and work well in a team.You are self-initiated and proactiveYou think of the bigger picture (e.g. beyond that 1-line code change)You are willing to learn from a whole bunch of amazing people

Job Description: Requirements: At least one (3) year relevant experience gained in semiconductor company Experience in application of QC tools, 8D, SPC Have good communication skill Responsibilities: Implements system for quality control is in place Drive cross-functional team on analysis of customer quality complaints and formulates corrective and preventive actions. The Hardware Quality Assurance Engineer takes charge of qualifying products, processes, and services to ensure product readiness for customers, working with development engineers and other teams in planning and running accelerated reliability tests to reduce cost impacts during the development life cycle. The role involves predicting reliability using statistical tools, finding and documenting key life-related failure modes found in printers, and using techniques to find root causes and resolve critical problems, so that the information can be used as input during the design and development phase. You must have: A bachelor’s degree in mechanical, electrical, computer, or electronics engineering, or relevant engineering backgroundRelevant work experience in product reliability engineering, failure analysis, product engineering, test engineering, or process engineeringWorking knowledge of reliability engineering principlesProject management skillsExperience with statistical methods and measures You must demonstrate: An ability to analyze problems and deliver complete detailed reportsAbility to multitaskExcellent communicationCollaboration and coordination skills to work effectively with cross functional teams of different cultures and backgrounds

The Partner Development Manager (PDM) is accountable for cultivating and maintaining good technical and business relationships with third-party Embedded Solutions Framework SDK (eSF SDK) partner developers and to use these relationships in order to inform, guide, and assist the partners into a productive and fruitful relationship with Lexmark. The PDM is also responsible for providing feedback to development regarding the takeaways and lessons learned from discussions with external-facing teams and third-party partners. Thus, they represent the partners to Lexmark development teams and also represents Lexmark products and development to partners and other external-facing groups. Interested candidates must have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or ECE. Programming skills are not required, however, a technical background and project management skills are required. A PDM must be able to understand the technical aspect of the partnership and develop a working knowledge of the eSF SDK and the architecture of the embedded system that the framework resides in to accurately assess the impact of issues as these are submitted and be able to react with appropriate urgency and priority. Interested applicants must have excellent communication skills; they are expected to articulate the situation in a manner that builds bridges with various internal and external development teams. They must also exhibit strong work ethic and ownership, and be motivated to get the job done and complete initiatives on behalf of the partners and the development teams they represent. Creative problem-solving skills, data analysis, and process-mapping are a plus. In this role, one is expected to drive the resolution of partner issues, to use partner data to determine areas for improvement, and to continuously review and improve the partner experience.

Reporting to the Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) Software Maintenance Supervisor – SCADA EMS Division, Luzon System Operations, the successful candidate will be responsible in ensuring all SCADA database and graphical drawings are reflective of the actual configuration of substations, plants and Distribution Utilities; analyzes the accuracy of SCADA real-time data in all control centers; and to perform all activities related to development, modification, configuration, maintenance and improvement of SCADA of National Control Center (NCC), Regional Area Control(RCC), Backup Regional Control Center (BRCC) and Area Control Centers(ACC). •Administers user accounts, access privileges, network communication/connection, applications, file system security, data archival, SCADA/EMS database back-up and resources of SCADA/EMS system; •Implements contingency plans to ensure optimum availability of SCADA system; •Maintain the accuracy, reliability and availability of the SCADA data historian and replicator system for data archiving used by SCADA customers; •Reviews all reports and documentations on SCADA/EMS availability, Breaker Status and Control Reports Analog MW Accuracy and ISO related documents; •Monitors and ensures the good quality of telemetered data received. Ensures that all supervisory controls are successfully and correctly executed; •Performs system back-up for on-line and off-line SCADA databases; •Checks and validates all modified and configured database entries of RCC, Backup RCC and ACC SCADA MMI; •Creates, updates, configures, modifies and fine-tunes all basic SCADA applications, database, Graphical Displays, Report Generation, Web Services, Market Function, etc; •Performs integration and commissioning o new stations and remote field devices into the RCC/Backup RCC/ACC Man-Machine Interface (MMI); •Performs point-to-point testing/validation of RCC/Backup RCC/ACC MMI database entries; •Implements, corrects build-up, modifications, and improvements of SCADA system database, graphics display generations; •Implements preventive and corrective SCADA software maintenance activities at RCC, Backup RCC & ACCs; troubleshoots run-time errors of SCADA applications; provides technical supports to end-users; evaluates correction of discrepancy notices related to SCADA software applications issued by end-users; •Prepares documentation related to the preventive and corrective software maintenance activities of SCADA applications and databases; •Implements programs to ensure high degree of availability and accuracy of snap shot data requirement of Market Operations from RCC and Backup RCC at all times; •Conducts and attends coordination meetings with internal and external functional groups concerning SCADA related activities; and acts as a resource speaker and conducts training programs related to SCADA System whenever necessary. REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or Electronics and Communication Engineering Course •At least four (4) years of relevant experience •Licensed Engineer – EE or ECE •Knowledge of current technological trends and developments in the area of information security •Working knowledge of DCS, PLC and SCADA/HMI control system software, hardware and architecture •Excellent technical knowledge of computer servers, PCs and network devices •Software and Hardware Troubleshooting •Knowledge of data communications protocols, networking equipment and computer operating systems such as Windows, LINUX and UNIX Attention: In relation to the Data Privacy Act of 2012, please be reminded that by providing your personal details, you agree that NGCP may use such information as part of your application and our assessment of your qualifications to the position posted or any other position where your qualifications may fit. The retention of the document is only 6 months upon receipt after the said period, any file (electronic or hardcopies) will be destroyed accordingly.

The Partner Development Manager (PDM) is accountable for cultivating and maintaining good technical and business relationships with third-party Embedded Solutions Framework SDK (eSF SDK) partner developers and to use these relationships in order to inform, guide, and assist the partners into a productive and fruitful relationship with Lexmark. The PDM is also responsible for providing feedback to development regarding the takeaways and lessons learned from discussions with external-facing teams and third-party partners. Thus, they represent the partners to Lexmark development teams and also represents Lexmark products and development to partners and other external-facing groups. Interested candidates must have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or ECE. Programming skills are not required, however, a technical background and project management skills are required. A PDM must be able to understand the technical aspect of the partnership and develop a working knowledge of the eSF SDK and the architecture of the embedded system that the framework resides in to accurately assess the impact of issues as these are submitted and be able to react with appropriate urgency and priority. Interested applicants must have excellent communication skills; they are expected to articulate the situation in a manner that builds bridges with various internal and external development teams. They must also exhibit strong work ethic and ownership, and be motivated to get the job done and complete initiatives on behalf of the partners and the development teams they represent. Creative problem-solving skills, data analysis, and process-mapping are a plus. In this role, one is expected to drive the resolution of partner issues, to use partner data to determine areas for improvement, and to continuously review and improve the partner experience.
